title: US, China to Begin Nuclear Arms Talks Before Xi-Biden Meeting
description: The US is set to hold rare nuclear arms control talks with China amid growing concerns over Beijing’s accelerated push to build up its arsenal of atomic weapons, according to an administration official.

title: Japan’s Kishida Set to Unveil Stimulus Package as Support Sags
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is set to announce a larger-than-expected economic stimulus package that aims to boost growth and help households hit by inflation, as his administration tries to shore up falling support.

title: Biden Will Visit Maine on Friday After Latest Mass Shooting
description: President Joe Biden on Friday will visit Maine, where a gunman killed 18 people and wounded more than a dozen others in the latest mass shooting to rock the nation.

title: Biden Will Launch New Campaign Against Islamophobia
description: President Joe Biden will launch a new national strategy to combat Islamophobia amid criticism from some Muslim Americans over the administration’s support for Israel’s campaign against Hamas that has resulted in thousands of civilian deaths across the Gaza Strip.

title: Saudi Arabia’s Budget Slips Deeper Into Deficit in Third Quarter
description: Saudi Arabia posted a budget deficit in the third quarter that was almost seven times larger than the previous three months, as both oil and non-oil income in the world’s biggest crude exporter declined.

title: Congress Grasps for Way Out of Standoff on Israel, Ukraine Aid
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional reporter Steven T. Dennis looks at the standoff over aid to Israel and Ukraine. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Housing Concerns Prompt Halt in Canada Immigration Target Boost
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is slowing down the increases in its key immigration targets amid growing concerns that record population gains are exacerbating housing shortages.

title: Acapulco Needs at Least 5 Times More Than AMLO’s Recovery Pledge
description: The economic toll from Hurricane Otis in the Mexican resort of Acapulco could top $20 billion, far beyond what the government has set aside so far to rebuild it.

title: Meloni Tricked Into Admission of Ukraine Fatigue by Russian Duo
description: Giorgia Meloni became the latest prank victim of a pair of notorious Russian comedians, who tricked the Italian premier into a phone call during which she said that Ukraine’s allies are growing weary of the war.

title: Leftist Leaders Pull Israel Ambassadors in Latin American Rebuke
description: Latin America’s leftist leaders are reevaluating their relations with Israel over its offensive in the Gaza Strip, highlighting the diplomatic risks posed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s bid to eradicate Hamas.

title: Nigeria President Warns Cabinet Ministers: Deliver or Get Fired
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu threatened to fire cabinet ministers and other civil servants who fail to perform, as he implements wide-ranging reforms aimed at revitalizing growth in Africa’s biggest economy.

title: ‘Trump Too Small’ Trademark Bid Gets Supreme Court Skepticism
description: US Supreme Court justices suggested they will rule against a man who says he has First Amendment right to seek federal trademark protection for the mocking phrase “Trump too small.”

title: Denmark Drops Treason Case Against Former Defense Minister
description: Denmark’s state prosecutor has dropped criminal proceedings against a former defense minister, Claus Hjort Frederiksen, who had been charged with treason for allegedly leaking state secrets.

title: Costco, Resideo Queried Over Products Tied to China Suppliers
description: A congressional committee asked Costco Wholesale Corp. and a unit of security-equipment seller Resideo Technologies Inc. to explain why they’ve sold products linked to two sanctioned Chinese companies.

title: How West Bank, Settlements Fit Into Israel-Hamas War
description: In the months before militants of the Palestinian group Hamas launched a new war by bursting out of the Gaza Strip Oct. 7 to commit a massacre in Israel, a different enclave, the West Bank, had been the greater source of friction between Israelis and Palestinians. Now, the war between Israel and Hamas has further inflamed conflict there. In the West Bank, unlike in Gaza, not only are Israeli soldiers ever-present, so are Israeli civilians. They are residents of the so-called West Bank settlement

title: Boris Johnson’s Team Broke UK Covid Rules Every Day, Probe Told
description: Pandemic rules were broken on a daily basis in Boris Johnson’s Downing Street offices, where the former prime minister’s top team oversaw a “toxic” and “macho” culture that ignored women’s perspectives, a former senior civil servant told the UK’s official inquiry.

title: Boris Johnson Let the UK Down by Not Tackling Cummings' Misogyny, Says Ex-Official
description: The senior civil servant about whom Dominic Cummings wrote "violent and misogynistic" messages has said Boris Johnson let the country down by not tackling the "toxic" culture he presided over.

title: US, China Agree to Work With UK to Protect Against AI Risks
description: The US, China and 26 other nations agreed to work together to protect against the potential for artificial intelligence to cause “catastrophic harm,” as government ministers and industry executives met on Wednesday at the UK’s global AI Safety summit.

title: The Winners and Losers in South Africa’s Budget
description: With the tax windfall from a commodities boom over and a revenue shortfall of 56.8 billion rand ($3 billion) expected this fiscal year, South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana has unveiled plans to significantly increase borrowing to plug a budget funding shortfall.

title: South Africa Will Borrow More, Spends Less to Tackle Revenue Shortfall
description: South Africa’s National Treasury said it will ramp up borrowing, trim spending and raise taxes to compensate for a revenue shortfall, spiraling debt-servicing costs and a higher state wage bill.

title: Biden’s Israel Balancing Act Gets Harder as Gaza Offensive Grows
description: After internet and mobile phone service abruptly disappeared in the Gaza Strip on Friday, US officials gave Israel a quiet but clear message: Get the networks up and running again.

title: Trump’s Three Children Set to Testify in His NY Fraud Trial
description: Three of Donald Trump’s children who helped run his sprawling real estate company for years will testify over the next week in their father’s civil fraud trial — a rare look at the fiercely loyal siblings under oath.

title: Deep in Trump Country, Biden Plan Creates Hundreds of Green Jobs
description: In the reddest district in America, First Solar is building a $1.1 billion solar-panel factory.

title: What Future for Gaza After the Israel-Hamas War?
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: North Korea Sent 1 Million Rounds of Artillery to Russia, Spy Agency Says
description: North Korea has sent more than 1 million rounds of artillery to Russia that President Vladimir Putin appears to be using in his bombardment of Ukraine, according to a lawmaker briefed by South Korea’s spy agency.

title: Zimbabwe Starts Polio Vaccinations After Outbreak in Capital
description: Zimbabwe began a polio inoculation campaign after an outbreak of the crippling disease in parts of the capital, the Ministry of Health said.

title: Biden’s Road Trip Exposes Democratic Fault Lines on Israel
description: Joe Biden’s trip to Minnesota on Wednesday is a microcosm for the issues currently bedeviling his presidency.

title: Schumer Urges US FTC Probe of Exxon, Chevron Mega-Deals
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is urging the US Federal Trade Commission to look into whether Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp.’s proposed oil and gas acquisitions could violate antitrust laws.

title: West Bank Risks Becoming a New Front for Israel
description: Widespread arrests, a rising death toll and an economic slump are combining to stoke tensions in the West Bank, which is threatening to become a new front for Israel as it battles Hamas in Gaza.

title: Foreigners Begin Exit From Gaza Through Rafah Crossing
description: The first group of foreigners since Israel began its ground invasion of Gaza have begun leaving the war-ravaged territory, heading into Egypt through the Rafah border crossing, according to footage aired on Arab satellite channels.

title: UK Removes Guarantees on £1 Billion of Covid Loans, Reuters Says
description: The UK has eliminated the guarantee on £979 million ($1.2 billion) of loans made to businesses during the Covid pandemic, according to Reuters.

title: Israel Says Nine More Soldiers Killed in Gaza Amid Heavy Clashes
description: Israel said nine more of its soldiers had died in clashes in Gaza as it steps up efforts to wipe out Hamas, the militant group that rules the Palestinian enclave.

title: Brace for Elections: 40 Countries Are Voting in 2024
description: Prepare for major policy changes and rising geopolitical friction everywhere from Washington, DC, to Taiwan.

title: Kamala Harris Will Lay Out AI Strategy in London Speech
description: Vice President Kamala Harris, in a speech in London, will lay out the burgeoning risks related to artificial intelligence, calling for international cooperation and stricter standards to protect consumers from the technology.

title: Israel Latest: Hamas Says Some Foreigners Can Leave Gaza
description: Hamas said some foreigners and injured Palestinians would be allowed to leave Gaza for Egypt for the first time since Israel began its ground invasion of the besieged territory.

title: In Major Protectionist Move, Spain Considers Stake in Telefonica
description: Spain is considering whether to shield its “most strategic” company from foreign takeovers in what could be the the government’s most significant protectionist move in more than a decade.

title: Web Summit’s Israel Mess Didn’t Surprise Those Who Know Its CEO
description: Paddy Cosgrave, the man behind Europe’s largest tech event, has a history of controversies and online squabbles.

title: US Imposes Sanctions on Myanmar Junta’s Lucrative Oil Enterprise
description: The US announced sanctions against the Myanmar junta’s most lucrative state-owned enterprise, one of Washington’s most significant moves yet to curtail the military regime’s access to easy cashflow to buy weapons.

title: White House Warns That Biden Would Veto GOP’s Israel Aid Bill
description: The White House said President Joe Biden would veto a bill proposed by House Republicans to provide assistance for Israel that would be paid for by slashing funds for the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Australian PM Pressed to Help Free Detained Writer on China Trip
description: The sons of Australian writer Yang Hengjun, who has been detained in China for more than four years, urged Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to press the case for their father’s release during his visit to Beijing.

title: Panama Congress Committee Votes in Favor of Mine Referendum
description: Panama’s proposal to hold a referendum on the controversial contract with Canadian miner First Quantum Minerals Ltd. was approved by a legislative committee Tuesday, clearing the first hurdle as the bill is fast tracked in congress.

title: House Ethics Panel Will Disclose Action on George Santos by Nov. 17
description: The House Ethics Committee handed Speaker Mike Johnson a possible way out of a difficult vote Wednesday to expel embattled Republican George Santos from Congress.
